From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From motiu +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [mu.tiˈβa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [mo.tiˈva]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [mo.tiˈvaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

motivar (first-person singular present motivo, first-person singular preterite motiví, past participle motivat)

  1. (transitive) to motivate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of motivar (first conjugation)

gerund motivant
past participle masculine feminine
singular motivat motivada
plural motivats motivades
person singular plural
first second third first second third

nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present motivo motives motiva motivem motiveu motiven
imperfect motivava motivaves motivava motivàvem motivàveu motivaven
future motivaré motivaràs motivarà motivarem motivareu motivaran
preterite motiví motivares motivà motivàrem motivàreu motivaren
conditional motivaria motivaries motivaria motivaríem motivaríeu motivarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present motivi motivis motivi motivem motiveu motivin

imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — motiva motivi motivem motiveu motivin
negative (no) — no motivis no motivi no motivem no motiveu no motivin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • motivació
  • motivador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “motivar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “motivar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “motivar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “motivar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From motivo +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /mo.t͡ʃiˈva(ʁ)/ [mo.t͡ʃiˈva(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /mo.t͡ʃiˈva(ʁ)/ [mo.t͡ʃiˈva(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /mo.t͡ʃiˈva(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /mo.t͡ʃiˈva(ʁ)/ [mo.t͡ʃiˈva(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /mo.t͡ʃiˈva(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /mu.tiˈvaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /mu.tiˈvaɾ/
    • (Northern Portugal) IPA(key): /mu.tiˈbaɾ/ [mu.tiˈβaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /mu.tiˈva.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: mo‧ti‧var

Verb

[edit]

motivar (first-person singular present motivo, first-person singular preterite motivei, past participle motivado)

  1. (transitive) to motivate
  2. (transitive) to cause, induce, provoke

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of motivar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • desmotivar

Further reading

[edit]
  • “motivar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From motivo +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /motiˈbaɾ/ [mo.t̪iˈβ̞aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: mo‧ti‧var

Verb

[edit]

motivar (first-person singular present motivo, first-person singular preterite motivé, past participle motivado)

  1. (transitive) to motivate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of motivar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive motivar
gerund motivando
past participle masculine feminine
singular motivado motivada
plural motivados motivadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person

vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros

vosotras 		ellos/ellas

negative no motives no motive no motivemos no motivéis no motiven

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.

  • motivador
